javacsw.services.alarms

Interface IAlarmServiceAdmin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JAlarmServiceAdmin

    public interface IAlarmServiceAdmin
    Java admin API for the alarm service.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • initAlarms

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.List<AscfValidation.Problem>> initAlarms(java.io.File inputFile,
                                                                                          boolean reset)
        Initializes the alarm data in the database using the given file
        Parameters:
        inputFile - the alarm service config file containing info about all the alarms
        reset - if true, delete the current alarms before importing (default: false)
        Returns:
        a future list of problems that occurred while validating the config file or ingesting the data into the database

      • getAlarms

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.List<AlarmModel>> getAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the alarm information from the database for any matching alarms
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - a key that may match multiple alarms (via wildcards, see AlarmKey.apply())
        Returns:
        a future sequence of alarm model objects

        Returns:
        a future alarm model object

      • getHealth

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<AlarmModel.Health> getHealth(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the health of the system, subsystem or component, based on the given alarm key.
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        Returns:
        the future health value (good, ill, bad)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        subscriber - an actor that will receive a HealthStatus message whenever the health for the given key changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        IAlarmServiceAdmin.AlarmHandler notifyAlarm,
                                        IAlarmServiceAdmin.HealthHandler notifyHealth,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        notifyAlarm - a function that will be called with an AlarmStatus object whenever the severity of an alarm changes
        notifyHealth - a function that will be called with a HealthStatus object whenever the total health for key pattern changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • shutdown

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.Unit> shutdown()
        Shuts down the the database server (For use in test cases that started the database themselves)
        Returns:
        a future indicating when shutdown has completed

      • startAlarmService

        static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> startAlarmService(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                         java.lang.Boolean noExit,
                                                                                         scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext ec)
        Starts a redis instance on a random free port (redis-server must be in your shell path) and registers it with the location service. This is the equivalent of running this from the command line: {{{ tracklocation --name "Alarm Service Test" --command "redis-server --port %port" --no-exit }}} This method is mainly for use by tests. In production, you would use the tracklocation app to start Redis once.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use to register the alarm service with the location service
        noExit - if true, do not exit the application when redis exists
        ec - required for futures
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the redis server exits
